doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF PROVIDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FOR THE DASR PROGRAM PRODUCTION
SOURCE CHARACTERIZATION

RAISINS (GO-13046; PI: KIRSHNER) IS AN ONGOING HUBBLE SPACE TELESCOPE OBSERVING PROGRAM THAT EXPLOITS MEASUREMENTS MADE WITH A 2.4M TELESCOPE IN SPACE USING A NEAR-IR DETECTOR TO OBSERVE TYPE IA SUPERNOVAE (SN IA) TO CONSTRAIN DARK ENERGY PROPERTIES. THIS EXISTING PROGRAM HAS MANY SIMILARITIES WITH THE PROPOSED WFIRST/AFTA SUPERNOVA SURVEY SKETCHED BY THE SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM AND THE WFIRST PROJECT. THE RAISIN (AN ANAGRAM FOR SN IA IN THE IR) PROGRAM IS ALSO AIMED AT THE SAME COSMOLOGICAL GOAL. ALTHOUGH RAISIN IS MODEST IN SCOPE COMPARED TO THE WFIRST MISSION (ONLY 100 ORBITS), IT IS BEING DONE NOW (THE MOST RECENT IMAGES WERE TAKEN ON JUNE 17, 2014) AND PRODUCES REAL DATA FOR ANALYSIS, NOT SIMULATIONS. OUR AIM IN THE NEXT TWO YEARS IS, WITH SUPPORT FROM THE WFIRST PREPARATORY SCIENCE PROGRAM, TO APPLY THE DATA WE HAVE AND THE METHODS WE HAVE DEVELOPED TO ANALYZE RAISIN DATA TO HELP THE SDT AND WFIRST PROJECT SHARPEN THEIR PLAN FOR SUPERNOVA COSMOLOGY WITH WFIRST/AFTA. WE WILL ALSO ADAPT OUR METHODS TO THE NEW TYPES OF DATA THAT WFIRST WILL OBTAIN. AS THE SDT REPORT STATES, THE 2010 DECADAL SURVEY, NEW WORLDS, NEW HORIZONS, SOUGHT TO ADVANCE TWO OF THE HIGHEST PRIORITY ASTROPHYSICS PROGRAMS 'THE QUEST TO UNDERSTAND THE ACCELERATION OF THE UNIVERSE, AND THE SEARCH FOR OTHER WORLDS.' OUR PROPOSED WORK IS PERFECTLY ALIGNED WITH THE FIRST OF THOSE GOALS.

doc.ContractDescription: SOLAR CORONAL JETS ARE ARCHETYPAL EXAMPLES OF RECONNECTION IN ASTROPHYSICAL PLASMAS. THEIR FREQUENCY, SIMPLE TOPOLOGY SIZE AND DURATION MAKE THEM IDEAL TARGETS FOR DETAILED MULTI-WAVELENGTH, MULTI-INSTRUMENT ANALYSIS. THE INTERFACE REGION IMAGING SPECTROGRAPH IRIS HAS THE SPATIAL RESOLUTION AND SPECTRAL COVERAGE TO OBSERVE JET PLASMA SURROUNDING THE RECONNECTION REGION IN UNPRECEDENTED DETAIL. THE IRIS SPATIAL RESOLUTION (0.) IS CRITICAL FOR THESE INVESTIGATIONS. USING THE SIMULTANEOUS SLIT-JAW IMAGES AND TRANSITION REGION LINE SPECTRA (E.G. SI IV, O IV) WE WILL FOLLOW THE EVOLUTION OF THE JET AND IDENTIFY THE PLASMA DYNAMICS AROUND THE SPECTRAL LOCATION WHILE OBTAINING VELOCITY, DENSITY AND NON-THERMAL LINE WIDTHS ALONG THE SLIT. HINODE AND SDO OBSERVATIONS GIVE IMPORTANT CONTEXT: PHOTOSPHERIC MAGNETIC FIELD STRUCTURE AND EVOLUTION, CORONAL PLASMA DYNAMICS AND ENERGETICS. INITIALLY, WE WILL USE EXISTING OBSERVATIONS OF SEVEN CORONAL JETS SEEN BY IRIS, HINODE AND SDO TO ADDRESS THREE CRITICAL GOALS: IDENTIFY THE STRUCTURE AND DYNAMICS OF THE ACCELERATION REGION IN CORONAL JETS. BUILD AND EVOLVE DATA-CONSTRAINED 3D MAGNETIC MODELS OF THE RECONNECTION REGION USING PHOTOSPHERIC MAGNETIC FIELDS, CHROMOSPHERIC AND CORONAL OBSERVATIONS IN ORDER TO INTERPRET THE PLASMA INFORMATION. IDENTIFY THE MECHANISM FOR SUPPLYING PLASMA TO AND ACCELERATING THE JET. ADDRESSING THE COMPLEX PROBLEMS OUTLINED ABOVE REQUIRES OBSERVATIONS FROM MULTIPLE SPACE- CRAFT AND STATEOFTHEART MODELING TOOLS. OUR APPROACH IS TO USE: DETAILED IRIS ANALYSIS OF NON-THERMAL WIDTH, DOPPLER VELOCITY AND ASYMMETRY, DENSITY, AND TEMPERATURE MAPS JOINT ANALY SIS OF HINODE/XRT AND EIS, AND SDO/AIA AND HMI OBSERVATIONS; 3D DATA-CONSTRAINED MAGNETIC FIELD MODELING USING STATIC POTENTIAL AND NON-LINEAR FORCE-FREE FIELD MODELS; MAGNETOFRICTIONAL AND MHD SIMULATIONS. ALL OF THE DIAGNOSTIC MODELING TOOLS EXIST AND HAVE BEEN TESTED, SO NO CODE DEVELOPMENT IS REQUIRED. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS RELEVANT TO THE INSTRUMENT GOAL OF INVESTIGATING THE TRANSPORT OF ENERGY AND MATTER FROM THE CHROMOSPHERE AND TRANSITION REGION TO THE CORONA.
doc.MajorAgency: STUDIES OF RECONNECTION IN CORONAL JETS OBSERVED W

doc.ContractDescription: RESEARCH THAT SUPPORTS QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENT OF MARS' SURFACE AS A POTENTIAL HABITAT FOR LIFE, PAST OR PRESENT, IS OF CRITICAL IMPORTANCE TO THE FUTURE OF NASA'S MARS EXPLORATION PROGRAM. IN THIS PROPOSAL, WE PRESENT A RESEARCH PROGRAM TO SUPPORT IMPROVEMENTS IN OUR UNDERSTANDING OF CHEMICAL COMPOSITION OF MARTIAN MATERIALS AS MEASURED IN SITU USING THE TECHNIQUE OF LASERINDUCED BREAKDOWN SPECTROSCOPY (LIBS). THROUGH KNOWLEDGE OF COMPOSITION AND MINERALOGY INFERRED FROM ITS RESULTS, WE CAN BETTER CHARACTERIZE GEOLOGICAL FEATURES ON MARS, INCLUDING THOSE THAT SUPPORT INTERPRETATIONS RELATED TO THE ROLE OF AQUEOUS PROCESSES. IN SERVICE OF THESE MARS PROGRAM GOALS, THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS IN THE ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES DERIVED FROM LIBS DATA, SUCH AS THOSE FROM THE CHEMCAM INSTRUMENT ON THE CURIOSITY ROVER. TO THIS END, WE WILL USE TRANSFER LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO ADDRESS THREE FUNDAMENTAL OBJECTIVES: 1. UNDERSTAND THE EFFECTS OF VARIABLE ABLATION AND COLLECTION ANGLES ON THE ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES DERIVED FROM LIBS. 2. DEVELOP CORRECTIONS FOR VARIATIONS IN SPECTRAL RESOLUTION, PULSE ENERGY, INSTRUMENT DRIFT, SIGNAL TO NOISE, AND SAMPLE PREPARATION ACROSS DIFFERENCE LIBS INSTRUMENTS TO FACILITATE INTER-LABORATORY COMPARISONS AND CROSS-CALIBRATIONS. 3. IMPLEMENT A COMPUTATIONAL METHOD TO CORRECT FOR VARIABLE DISTANCE BETWEEN TARGET AND LASER BASED ON IN SITU ANALYSES OF DUST ON MARS. THIS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH IS DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO THE MARS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH PROGRAM BECAUSE IT PROVIDES NOVEL, ENHANCED ALGORITHMS TO SUPPORT AND IMPROVE QUANTITATIVE CHEMICAL ANALYSES OF MARTIAN MATERIALS. IT IS SIGNIFICANT BECAUSE IT WILL IMPROVE THE BREADTH AND ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM CHEMCAM AND FUTURE LIBS INSTRUMENTS, ENHANCING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF GEOCHEMICAL AND GEOLOGICAL PROCESSES ON THE SURFACE OF MARS.
doc.MajorAgency: TRANSFER LEARNING FOR CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM LASER
doc.MajorFundingAgency: TRANSFER LEARNING FOR CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM LASER

doc.ContractDescription: AIRBEAMTRANSPORTVESSEL-CHR PROTOTYPE

WE PROPOSE A RESEARCH PROGRAM THAT WILL ANALYZE A VARIETY OF DATA WITH THE GOAL OF PROVIDING INSIGHT INTO POSSIBLE CAUSAL MECHANISMS OF STRATOSPHERE-IONOSPHERE COUPLING DURING SUDDEN STRATOSPHERIC WARMING (SSW) EVENTS. THE PROPOSED STUDY WILL FOCUS ON THREE KEY ALTITUDE REGIONS AT LOW AND MIDDLE LATITUDES: 1) THE STRATOSPHERE, WHERE SEMIDIURNAL TIDES ARE GENERATED THROUGH THE ABSORPTION OF SOLAR UV BY OZONE MOLECULES; 2) THE LOWER THERMOSPHERE, WHERE TIDES REACH THEIR LARGEST AMPLITUDES AND DRIVE THE E-REGION DYNAMO; AND 3) THE IONOSPHERE, WHERE SUDDEN STRATOSPHERIC WARMING EFFECTS ARE THE STRONGEST AT LOW AND MIDDLE LATITUDES. SCIENCE FOCUS QUESTIONS ON WHICH WE WILL REACH CLOSURE ARE QUANTITATIVE IDENTIFICATION OF KEY SSW TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL EFFECTS IN 1) STRATOSPHERIC PLANETARY WAVE, WIND, TEMPERATURE, AND OZONE MASS MIXING RATIO PERTURBATIONS; 2) LOWER THERMOSPHERE TIDE AND E REGION IONOSPHERIC MODIFICATIONS; AND 3) IONOSPHERIC F REGION AND TEC RESPONSES. WE WILL USE ECMWF (EUROPEAN CENTER FOR MEDIUM RANGE WEATHER FORECAST) AND NASA MERRA (THE MODERN ERA RETROSPECTIVE-ANALYSIS FOR RESEARCH AND APPLICATIONS) REANALYSIS DATA TO CHARACTERIZE VARIATIONS IN STRATOSPHERIC PARAMETERS, INCLUDING TEMPERATURE, PLANETARY WAVE ACTIVITY, ZONAL AND MERIDIONAL WIND, AND OZONE MASS MIXING RATIO. LOWER THERMOSPHERIC DATA FROM INCOHERENT SCATTER RADARS WILL BE USED TO EXAMINE VARIATIONS IN TIDAL MODES AROUND STRATOSPHERIC WARMING EVENTS, WITH THE FOCUS ON INFERRING THE TEMPORAL DEVELOPMENT OF TIDAL COMPONENTS. GPS TOTAL ELECTRON CONTENT (TEC) MEASUREMENTS AND INCOHERENT SCATTER RADAR DATA WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY AND EXAMINE THE IONOSPHERIC RESPONSE TO STRATOSPHERIC WARMINGS USING OBSERVATIONS OF THE IONOSPHERIC VERTICAL DRIFT, THE DENSITY AND HEIGHT OF THE F2 REGION PEAK (NMF2 AND HMF2), AND THE TEC. THE RESULTS OF THIS RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE A UNIQUE AND VALUABLE SET OF OBSERVATIONAL TRUTH AND OBSERVATIONAL CONSTRAINTS FOR THE TEAM MODELING EFFORT.
doc.MajorAgency: CHARACTERIZATION OF THE STRATOSPHERIC, LOWER THERM
doc.MajorFundingAgency: CHARACTERIZATION OF THE STRATOSPHERIC, LOWER THERM

doc.ContractDescription: DELIVERY ORDER FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF WIND SENSORS FOR THE FAA ASWON TECHNICAL REFRESH PROGRAM.

STARS ARE ASSEMBLED IN MOLECULAR CLOUDS THROUGH THE GRAVITATIONAL COLLAPSE OF DENSE CORES OF GAS AND DUST. THE FINAL MASSES OF STARS ARE SET DURING THE PROTOSTELLAR STAGE BY THE COMPLEX INTERACTION OF MANY INTERRELATED PHYSICAL PROCESSES, INCLUDING THE UNDERLYING CORE MASS FUNCTION, CORE AND DISK FRAGMENTATION (FORMATION OF BINARIES), THE FORMATION AND EVOLUTION OF PROTOPLANETARY DISKS, AND MASS-LOSS THROUGH DIRECT EJECTION OF JETS AND ENTRAINMENT OF SURROUNDING MATERIAL IN MOLECULAR OUTFLOWS. THE FORMATION OF BINARY SYSTEMS, THE EVOLUTION OF PROTOPLANETARY DISKS, AND THE FINAL STELLAR MASS ALL HAVE IMPORTANT IMPLICATIONS FOR THE FORMATION OF PLANETS. SEVERAL KEY QUESTIONS RELATED TO THE GROWTH OF STARS AND PROTOPLANETARY DISKS ARE YET TO BE ANSWERED, INCLUDING: (1) WHEN, WHERE, AND HOW DO CORES AND DISKS FRAGMENT INTO MULTIPLE SYSTEMS? (2) WHAT ROLE DO DISKS PLAY IN THE TRANSFER OF MASS FROM CORES TO STARS? (3) TO WHAT EXTENT DO OUTFLOWS REGULATE THE PROTOSTELLAR MASS ACCRETION PROCESS? TO ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS, WE PROPOSE TO CONDUCT A CONTINUUM AND MOLECULAR LINE EMISSION SURVEY OF ALL 73 PROTOSTARS IN THE NEARBY PERSEUS MOLECULAR CLOUD, WITH THE VLA AT 7-MM, AND THE SMA AT 230 AND 345 GHZ, IN BOTH DUST CONTINUUM AND MOLECULAR LINE EMISSION. OUR PROGRAM WILL ENABLE SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS IN ANSWERING ALL THREE OF THESE QUESTIONS AND ULTIMATELY DETERMINING HOW STARS ARE ASSEMBLED FROM THE SURROUNDING DENSE GAS.

doc.ContractDescription: THE USE OF AUTONOMOUS WAVE GLIDERS IS PROPOSED FOR SURVEYS AND MONITORING OF THE UPPER OCEAN CONDITIONS DURING THE SPURS-2 FRESHWATER PROGRAM IN 2016-2017. SPECIAL FOCUS WILL BE GIVEN TO NEAR-SURFACE SALINITY AND TEMPERATURE STRUCTURE WITH ADDITIONAL SENSORS. THE LONGEVITY AND PROGRAMABILITY OF THE WAVE GLIDERS ALLOWS FOR BOTH FULL COVERAGE OF THE OBSERVING PERIOD AND FLEXIBILITY IN SAMPLING PLANS. DURING THE DEPLOYMENT AND RECOVERY CRUISES, SMALL "IVER" AUTONOMOUS UNDERWATER VEHICLES WILL BE DEPLOYED ON SHORT DURATION MISSIONS TO EXAMINE THE DETAILED STRUCTURE OF RAIN-FORMED FRESH PUDDLES AT THE OCEAN SURFACE. THE COMBINATION OF PROVEN ENDURANCE AND MOBILITY OF THE WAVE GLIDERS ASSURES THE MAINTENANCE OF SURVEY PATTERNS IN THE STRONG CURRENT REGIME OF SPURS-2, AND THE FLEXIBILITY AND PRECISION OF THE IVER AUVS ENABLES VERY DETAILED LOOKS AT SPECIFIC RAIN-PUDDLE FEATURES.
doc.MajorAgency: AUTONOMOUS SURVEYS IN THE SPURS FRESHWATER REGION
doc.MajorFundingAgency: AUTONOMOUS SURVEYS IN THE SPURS FRESHWATER REGION

doc.ContractDescription: PLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS OF THE GLOBAL OCEAN PROFOUNDLY AFFECT CLIMATE AND LIFE ON EARTH. NASAS OCEAN COLOR SATELLITE RECORD TELLS US THAT THESE INVALUABLE ECOSYSTEMS ARE HIGHLY RESPONSIVE TO CLIMATE VARIABILITY, WITH CHANGES IN OCEAN PRODUCTION IMPACTING FOOD PRODUCTION, UPTAKE OF ATMOSPHERIC CO2, AND EMISSION OF CLIMATE-REGULATING AEROSOLS. INTERGOVERNMENTAL PANEL ON CLIMATE CHANGE CLIMATE SIMULATIONS SUGGEST THAT SURFACE OCEAN TEMPERATURES WILL WARM BY +1.3 TO +2.8 C GLOBALLY OVER THE 21ST CENTURY, WITH MAJOR CONSEQUENCES ON PHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF THE SURFACE OCEAN WHERE PLANKTON POPULATIONS THRIVE. THE PRESSING QUESTION IS, HOW WILL THESE CHANGES ALTER PLANKTON PRODUCTION, SPECIES COMPOSITION, AND AEROSOL EMISSIONS TODAY, EVEN THE SIGN OF THESE POTENTIAL NAAMES COMBINES SHIP, AIRCRAFT, SATELLITE, AUTONOMOUS SENSOR, AND MODELING DATA TO ADDRESS KNOWLEDGE GAPS ON OCEAN PLANKTON AND THEIR BIOGENIC AEROSOL EMISSIONS. CHANGES REMAINS UNRESOLVED. OUR ABILITY TO PREDICT EARTH SYSTEM CONSEQUENCES OF A WARMING OCEAN AND DEVELOP REALISTIC MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES DEPENDS ON RESOLVING CONFLICTING HYPOTHESES REGARDING FACTORS CONTROLLING PLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS AND BIOGENIC AEROSOL EMISSIONS.
doc.MajorAgency: THE NORTH ATLANTIC AEROSOL AND MARINE ECOSYSTEMS S

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CT::IGF LANDSCAPING SERVICES

ATMOSPHERIC AEROSOLS DEGRADE AIR QUALITY, CONTRIBUTE TO PREMATURE MORTALITY, IMPACT ECOSYSTEMS, AND CAN ALTER THE RADIATIVE BALANCE OF THE EARTH. IMPROVING OUR ABILITY TO MODEL AND INTERPRET OBSERVATIONS OF AEROSOLS IS THEREFORE CRITICAL TO THE PREDICTION OF FUTURE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH ON EARTH. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO EXPLORE THE UNCERTAINTY IN AEROSOL PHYSICAL AND OPTICAL PROPERTIES AND THE IMPLICATIONS FOR OUR UNDERSTANDING OF AEROSOL CLIMATE AND AIR QUALITY IMPACTS. WE AIM TO ADDRESS TWO PRIMARY QUESTIONS: 1. DOES THE SIMULATION OF A MORE COMPLEX AND REALISTIC REPRESENTATION OF THE AEROSOL SIZE DISTRIBUTION IMPROVE AGREEMENT WITH OBSERVATIONS? 2. WHEN AND WHERE ARE UNCERTAINTIES IN SPECIFIC AEROSOL PHYSICAL PROPERTIES IMPORTANT? THESE QUESTIONS ARE POSED IN THE CONTEXT OF DIRECT AEROSOL CLIMATE EFFECTS (THE DIRECT RADIATIVE EFFECT, DRE) AND THE ESTIMATION OF SURFACE AIR QUALITY FROM SPACE (SATELLITE-DERIVED PM2.5). WE WILL USE THE GLOBAL CHEMICAL TRANSPORT MODEL, GEOS-CHEM, WITH THE FAST RADIATIVE TRANSFER MODEL, RRTMG, AND A SUITE OF IN SITU AND SATELLITE AEROSOL OBSERVATIONS TO INVESTIGATE THESE QUESTIONS. IN DOING SO, WE WILL DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE, DECADAL, MULTI-PARAMETER, AEROSOL OBSERVATIONAL BENCHMARK, WHICH WILL BE USED HERE AS AN ARBITER OF MODEL SKILL. WE WILL COMPREHENSIVELY CHARACTERIZE AND ATTRIBUTE THE UNCERTAINTY IN MODEL PREDICTIONS OF AEROSOL IMPACTS AND PROPERTIES (AEROSOL OPTICAL DEPTH, SINGLESCATTERING ALBEDO, ASYMMETRY PARAMETER, ABSORPTION AOD, PM2.5/AOD, AND DRE). MODEL SKILL WILL BE EVALUATED AGAINST THE OBSERVATIONAL BENCHMARK IN LIGHT OF THESE UNCERTAINTIES, USING BOTH FORWARD MODEL COMPARISONS AND OPTIMAL ESTIMATION. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SEVERAL BENEFITS TO THE COMMUNITY: (1) A CONSOLIDATED DATABASE OF IN-SITU AND REMOTE MEASUREMENTS FOR EVALUATION OF GLOBAL AEROSOL MODELS, (2) COMPREHENSIVE UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATES OF AEROSOL OPTICAL AND RADIATIVE PROPERTIES THAT CAN BE USED TO BETTER INFORM INVERSE MODELING STUDIES AND PROVIDE ACCEPTABLE THRESHOLDS FOR MODEL-OBSERVATION COMPARISON STUDIES, AND (3) IDENTIFICATION OF REGIONS WHERE ADDITIONAL MEASUREMENT OR MODEL INVESTIGATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO RECONCILE MODEL SIMULATIONS AND AEROSOL OBSERVATIONS. THIS PROJECT TARGETS THE SECOND FOCUS AREA OF THE NASA ROSES ACCDAM CALL "THE FORMATION, PROPERTIES, AND TRANSPORT OF AEROSOLS". THE PROPOSED EXTENSIVE USE OF BOTH SUB-ORBITAL AND SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS ADDRESSES ALL THREE DESIRED CRITERIA PUT FORTH IN THE SOLICITATION.
doc.MajorAgency: PROPOSAL TITLE : HOW SENSITIVE ARE GLOBAL CLIMATE
doc.MajorFundingAgency: PROPOSAL TITLE : HOW SENSITIVE ARE GLOBAL CLIMATE

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF JPEO PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY MEDICAL COUNTERMEASURES ENTERPRISE (PHEMCE) ASSESSMENT
IGF::OT::IGF BASE OPERATIONS SUPPORT (BOS) SERVICES AT WESTOVER ARB, MA
ORDER MOD TO FUND THE FOURTH OPTION YEAR FOR $300,000.00

LIGHTWEIGHT HIGH RESOLUTION X RAY TELESCOPE OPTICS ARE ONE OF THE KEY TECHNOLOGIES UNDER DEVELOPMENT FOR NEXT GENERATION X RAY TELESCOPES. THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS EFFORT IS TO REALIZE OPTICS WITH SPATIAL RESOLUTION RIVALING CHANDRA (1 ARC SEC) BUT WITH COLLECTING AREAS THAT ARE LARGER BY ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE. IN THE USA SEVERAL INSTITUTIONS, INCLUDING GSFC, MSFC, HARVARD SAO, MIT AND NORTHWEST UNIVERSITY ARE WORKING ON A VARIETY OF APPROACHES TO THIS PROBLEM. AN EXCELLENT EXAMPLE IS THE NUSTAR X RAY TELESCOPE, WHICH TEAMED CAL TECH, GSFC, COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY AND LLNL TO PRODUCE A SUPERB SET OF HARD X RAY OPTICS. THE TELESCOPE WAS COMPOSED OF THOUSANDS OF 0.2 MM THICK GLASS MIRRORS WHICH WERE EPOXIED INTO PLACE AROUND A SPINDLE STRUCTURE. WHILE VERY LIGHT WEIGHT, THIS PROCESS RESULTED IN 1 ARC MIN RESOLUTION. WE WANT TO ACHIEVE 100 TIMES BETTER WITH SIMILAR MASS. A GROUP AT NASA GSFC HAS RECENTLY DEMONSTRATED AN ALTERNATIVE THIN GLASS ASSEMBLY PROCEDURE THAT HAS ACHIEVED 7 ARC SEC RESOLUTION WITH X RAY TESTS. FURTHER PROGRESS TOWARDS 1 ARC SEC WILL REQUIRE MIRRORS WITH IMPROVED FIGURE, LOWER STRESS COATINGS, IMPROVED ALIGNMENT, BETTER METROLOGY, AND LOW STRESS BONDING. MANY OF THE DIFFICULTIES WITH CURRENT MIRROR ASSEMBLY PRACTICE STEM FROM THE USE OF EPOXY AS A BONDING AGENT. EPOXY HAS MANY DISADVANTAGES, INCLUDING HIGH SHRINKAGE, LARGE CTE AND CREEP, RESIN AGING EFFECTS, WATER ABSORPTION, OUTGASSING, LOW TENSILE STRENGTH, EXOTHERMICITY, AND REQUIRING LARGE AMOUNTS OF TIME AND OR HEAT TO CURE. THESE EFFECTS CAN CAUSE ERRORS THAT BECOME FROZEN IN TO THE BOND WITH NO POSSIBILITY OF CORRECTION. WE PROPOSE TO INVESTIGATE REPLACING EPOXY WITH LOW TEMPERATURE, LOW SHRINKAGE SOLDER ALLOYS. WE USE THESE SOLDERS IN CONJUNCTION WITH HIGH POWER, MILLISEC LONG PULSES FROM A FIBER IR LASER TO DELIVER CONTROLLED AMOUNTS OF HEAT INTO THE BOND AREA. WE HAVE DEMONSTRATED THAT LASER PULSES CAN BE USED TO ACTUATE CAREFULLY DESIGNED BONDS BY PERMANENTLY COMPRESSING OR EXPANDING A VERY THIN AND BRIEF SURFACE MELT IN THE SOLDER BY AMOUNTS CONTROLLED IN THE NANOSCALE RANGE, ALLOWING POST ASSEMBLY CORRECTION OF THE MIRROR MOUNT POINTS. WE BELIEVE THIS TECHNOLOGY WILL BE ONE OF THE KEYS TO REALIZE A SUB 1 ARC SEC THIN GLASS X RAY TELESCOPE.
doc.MajorAgency: HIGH PRECISION ASSEMBLY OF THIN MIRROR X-RAY TELES
doc.MajorFundingAgency: HIGH PRECISION ASSEMBLY OF THIN MIRROR X-RAY TELES

doc.ContractDescription: THE NUETRON STAR COMPOSITION EXPLORER (NICER) DETECTOR SUBSYSTEM DELIVERED TO NASA UNDER THIS CONTRACT CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS: FLIGHT QUALIFIED SILICON DRIFT DETECTOR FOCAL PLANE MODULE ASSEMBLIES (FPM). FLIGHT QUALIFIED MEASUREMENT AND POWER UNITS (MPU) WITH ONBOARD, QUALIFIED FLIGHT SOFTWARE. FLIGHT QUALIFIED FPM TO MPU FLIGHT HARNESSES. GROUND SUPPORT EQUIPMENT (GSE). MPU SIMULATOR. A SUBSET OF THE DETECTOR GROUND BASED CALIBRATION PRODUCTS. GENERAL DATA REQUIREMENT PRODUCTS CALLED OUT UNDER THE CONTRACT. THE NICER DETECTOR SUBSYSTEM PROJECT AT MKI IS MANAGED IN PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) MODE WITH THE PI RESPONSIBLE FOR DELIVERING THE FLIGHT HARDWARE, SOFTWARE, CALIBRATION PRODUCTS AND DATA PRODUCTS TO THE NICER PROJECT OFFICE AT GSFC. THE PI WILL DELEGATE TECHNICAL AND PROGRAMMATIC ELEMENTS TO APPROPRIATE MEMBERS OF THE MKI NICER TEAM, WHO WILL BE THE DAY-TO-DAY POCS FOR THE GSFC NICER PROJECT OFFICE.
CONSIGNMENT SUPPLIES

doc.ContractDescription: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO UNDERSTAND PHASE SELECTION IN STRUCTURAL ALLOYS AND TO INVESTIGATE THE EFFECTS OF CONVECTION ON TIME-DEPENDENT NUCLEATION PHENOMENA DURING RAPID SOLIDIFICATION FROM THE MELT. THIS RESEARCH ADDRESSES FUNDAMENTAL ISSUES RELATING TO RAPID SOLIDIFICATION BEHAVIOR METASTABLE PHASE SELECTION AND ANALYSIS OF THE PROCESSES GOVERNING MICROSTRUCTURAL EVOLUTION.

doc.ContractDescription: THE PURPOSE OF NASA'S MARS' ATMOSPHERE AND VOLATILE EVOLUTION (MAVEN) MISSION, SCHEDULED FOR LAUNCH LATER THIS YEAR, IS TO STUDY THE LOSS OF THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERE TO SPACE. IN SUPPORT OF THE MISSION, THEORETICAL CALCULATIONS ARE PROPOSED FOR TWO OF THE MOST IMPORTANT MARTIAN OUTGASSING PROCESSES, THE DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION (DR) OF O2+ AND N2+, I.E. O2+ + E- ->O + O AND 15N14N+ + E- ->15N + 14N. EACH OF THESE REACTIONS IMPARTS SUFFICIENT ENERGY TO SOME OF THE PRODUCTS TO ALLOW FOR ATMOSPHERIC ESCAPE. O2+ IS THE MAJOR ION IN THE IONOSPHERE OF MARS AND DR CONTRIBUTES TO THE DETERMINATION OF MANY IONOSPHERIC PROPERTIES INCLUDING THE ELECTRON DENSITY AND TEMPERATURE. COMBINED WITH A THERMAL ESCAPE MECHANISM FOR H, DR OF O2+ MAY BE AN IMPORTANT LOSS MECHANISM FOR H2O AT MARS SINCE IT CAN IMPART ENOUGH KINETIC ENERGY FOR O ATMOSPHERIC ESCAPE. IT IS ALSO THE SOURCE OF A WELL KNOWN HOT O CORONA AT MARS AND BY COLLISION OF OTHER MOLECULES WITH HOT O, THESE OTHER SPECIES MAY ALSO ESCAPE. EXPERIMENTAL STUDIES HAVE NOT DETERMINED ABSOLUTE DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION RATE CONSTANTS, PRODUCT QUANTUM YIELDS AND ATOMIC KINETIC ENERGY DISTRIBUTIONS FOR VIBRATIONALLY EXCITED O2+ AT NONZERO ELECTRON ENERGIES AND THEREFORE DO NOT COVER THE RANGE OF ELECTRON TEMPERATURES AT MARS. YET THERE IS EVIDENCE FOR A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUNT OF VIBRATIONALLY EXCITED O2+ IN THE MARTIAN IONOSPHERE. VIBRATIONAL DEEXCITATION/ EXCITATION OF O2+ BY ELECTRON COLLISION IS LIKELY TO BE AN IMPORTANT PROCESS AND AN ELECTRON HEATING/COOLING MECHANISM BUT IT HAS NEVER BEEN STUDIED EXPERIMENTALLY OR THEORETICALLY. IT HAS BEEN KNOWN FOR SOME TIME THAT THE ENERGETICS OF THE DR OF 15N14N+ LEADS TO PREFERENTIAL ESCAPE OF 14N COMPARED TO 15N AND MAY ACCOUNT FOR THE LARGE MARTIAN 15N/14N RATIO WHICH IS 1.6 TIMES HIGHER THAN FOUND AT EARTH. HOWEVER, THE RATE CONSTANT FOR 15N14N+ HAS NEVER BEEN DETERMINED THEORETICALLY OR EXPERIMENTALLY AND THEREFORE THE MECHANISM MUST REMAIN UNCERTAIN. I PROPOSE TO CALCULATE THE UNKNOWN RATE CONSTANTS FOR EACH OF THESE PROCESSES. THE RESULTS WILL BE VITAL TO OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE DATA RETURNED FROM THE MAVEN MISSION. I PROPOSE TO USE THEORETICAL QUANTUM CHEMICAL METHODS INVOLVING LARGE SCALE WAVE FUNCTIONS AND THE MULTICHANNEL QUANTUM DEFECT THEORY IN THE STUDY OF THESE UNKNOWN PROCESSES. THIS APPROACH HAS BEEN SHOWN TO BE QUITE ACCURATE IN SIMILAR STUDIES OF THE DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION OF 14N14N+ COMPLETED IN THIS LABORATORY. INDEED, THIS LABORATORY IS IN A UNIQUE POSITION TO EFFICIENTLY COMPLETE THESE TASKS AND TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE DATA RETURNED BY THE MAVEN MISSION. FOR BOTH O2+ AND 15N14N+, MUCH OF THE DATA NEEDED TO PERFORM THE PROPOSED CALCULATIONS HAS ALREADY BEEN DETERMINED. FOR 15N14N+, ALL OF THE INPUT DATA HAS BEEN DETERMINED IN CALCULATIONS ALREADY COMPLETED FOR 14N14N+. I PROPOSE TO CALCULATE THE CROSS SECTIONS AND RATE COEFFICIENTS FOR DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION AND VIBRATIONAL CHANGE OF O2+ IN THE LOWEST SIX ION VIBRATIONAL LEVELS AND TO ALSO CALCULATE THE O ATOM PRODUCT STATE DISTRIBUTIONS AND THE ESCAPE FRACTIONS AS A FUNCTION OF ION VIBRATIONAL AND ELECTRON TEMPERATURES. THE SAME RATE CONSTANTS AND N ATOM PRODUCT STATE DISTRIBUTIONS AND ESCAPE FRACTIONS WILL BE CALCULATED FOR 15N14N+ FOR THE LOWEST 5 ION VIBRATIONAL LEVELS OVER THE WIDE RANGE OF ELECTRON TEMPERATURES FOUND AT MARS.
doc.MajorAgency: THEORETICAL STUDIES OF PLANETARY ESCAPE IN SUPPORT
